    		Welcome to Basic Needs
    	The Hungry Wildcat Food Pantry is OPEN!Spring 2023 Hours: Monday-Friday: 10 a.m. - 4 p.m.or by appointment call 530-898-4098.Students:Homeless? At risk of eviction?Unstable housing?Unexpected financial crisis?Not enough food?Trouble getting the right food?Fill out the easy Chico State Basic Needs Application for Assistance and visit the Hungry Wildcat Food Pantry on campus (Student Services Center 196).Would you like to donate? Thank you!Check out our Get Involved(opens in new window) page to check out what donation items we take! Please call 530-898-4098 to arrange a donation drop off at the Pantry.We will need the following information:NamePhone numberWhat types of items you would like to donate and quantityWhat day/time you are planning to drop off
*Please keep in mind, we don't accept open food items*Thank you for your continued support! 

                        Hungry Wildcat Food Pantry 
                    
                Easy access to healthy supplemental food for students facing food insecurity
    
                        Emergency shelter, Transitional and Rapid Re-Housing
                    
                Shelter, transitional and rapid re-housing for students facing unsafe housing or are actively unhoused or homeless.
    
                        Basic Needs Emergency Grants
                    Basic Needs Emergency Grants for students in unexpected or extenuating financial challenges
                        Get Involved
                    
                Find out how you can help
    Mission Statement   The mission of Chico State Basic Needs is to improve student success and positively engage the community through the provision of healthy food, emergency grants, financial wellness education, rapid re-housing, public health and wellness programming for students experiencing food insecurity, hunger, disasters, unstable housing, homelessness and poverty.Thank You VideoVice President for Student AffairsKendall Hall, Room 110530-898-6131www.csuchico.edu/saDivision of Student AffairsAccessibility Resource CenterAssociated StudentsBasic Needs ProjectCareer CenterEquity, Diversity & InclusionEarly Outreach & Support ProgramsEnrollment Management ServicesFinancial Aid & ScholarshipsIntercollegiate AthleticsOff-Campus Student ServicesStudent Conduct, Rights & ResponsibilitiesStudent Life & LeadershipUniversity HousingWellCat Services
We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
